Case: Shannon-Lankswert-WC-02-07-2025
Client: Shannon Lankswert

Friend working for UPS - 3rd Shift Fueler - Went to bathroom in Fuel Yard - Fell down metal stairs on her way out - Struck back & both arms/elbows on the way down stairs - Employer transported to Concentra - Advised of Back & Arm injury - Concentra checked arm & took xrays - Ignored Back Injury - Provided "work as tolerated" Note - Client followed up with Flaget Memorial when pain had not subsided - Placed off work at least Until 02.13 - Client returned to Concentra for PT 02/13 - Concentra advised Client that they are 'Not allowed by Law to place off work due to Account with UPS' - Concentra gave work restrictions - UPS unable to accommodate Restrictions - Forcing Client to use Vacation Time & PTO instead of initiating WC Claim - Client has been off work since DOI - Advised UPS should have initiated WC Claim once off work more than 3 days - Client is not sure how to proceed - Advised will send Intake Packet & mark as Hold until she decides if she wants us fully involved - Client appreciated the information & would like Intake Packet emailed to her

On Thu, 20 Feb 2025 14:44:23 -0500, Sarena Tuttle emailed Kaitlin Ericksen:

Case: Shannon-Lankswert-WC-02-07-2025
Client: Shannon Lankswert
__Re: Re: WC80D-H07503 Shannon Lankswert__
CC: Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
Good afternoon Kaitlin,
 Ms. Lankswert should be compensated appropriately from the date of the
incident until she is released back to full duty. Again, Ms. Lankswert is a
Fuel Truck Driver which requires her to sit for long periods of time, lift
heavy hoses & climb stairs, all of which causes additional pain & delays to
her recovery. Concentra has placed restrictions on Ms. Lankswert in lieu of
placing her off work only due to the fact Concentra apparently has a
standing order from UPS (who are not medical professionals) to NOT place
their employees off work (unethical on so many levels). Ms. Lankswert is
not able to drive due to being unable to sit for long periods of time, she
is unable to lift the hoses and she is unable to repeatedly climb stairs. These
are noted in her restrictions provided to you earlier today.
 ***May lift up to 10lbs (Hoses weigh well more than 10lbs)
 ***May push/pull up to 10 lbs (Again, hoses weigh more than
10lbs)
 ***May bend *occasionally *(occasionally defined as upto
3hrs/day - As a Full Time Fueler, bending is a constant requirement with
getting in & out of truck)
 ***May engage in activities requiring trunk rotation *occasionally

Good afternoon Kaitlin,
 Please find attached the Certified Medical Records from Concentra &
Flaget Memorial Hospital related to Mrs. Lankswert's injuries. To date, we
still have not received any response to our correspondence dated February
20th, 2025 in relation to Mrs. Lankswert's TTD Benefits and/or Form 114
Reimbursements.
 Upon review of the Concentra Medical Records, it appears the wrong job
description had been provided to them. According to their records, they
were provided "Air Handler" as Mrs. Lankswert's job title & based her
restrictions on the provided 'Air Handler Job Description'. Please confirm
that your file reflects the correct job title of "Full Time Fueler". These
are 2 very different types of jobs and the restrictions provided do not
allow Mrs. Lankswert to fulfill her duties as a 'Full Time Fueler' while
they may be sufficient for an "Air Handler" who sorts packages for a short
period of time (3-4hrs) each shift. Furthermore, these departments are
completely separate from each other & again, Mrs. Lankswert immediate
supervisor, is unable to accommodate her restrictions as provided by
Concentra. However, again, Mrs. Lankswert was placed off work on February
20th for an indefinite period, we assume at least until her next
evaluation. Please provide us with an immediate update on the status of her
claim.
Sarena M. Tuttle

Workers' Compensation Case Manager

Louisville, KY 40222

episode_body:
On Thu, 27 Feb 2025 16:06:20 -0500, Sarena Tuttle emailed Taylor Wood:

Case: Shannon-Lankswert-WC-02-07-2025
Client: Shannon Lankswert
__Re: Shannon Lankswert v UPS__
CC: Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
Thank you so much Taylor.
Good afternoon Mr. Lucas,
 Thank you so much for reaching out to us. Mr. Bryce Koon is the
attorney of record for our firm, I have included his contact information
below. Just to update you on the claim to date, Ms. Lankswert is a
Full-time (8hr) Fueler for United Parcel Service, who on Friday,
February 7, 2025 fell down a set of metal stairs (photo provided) while
within the scope of her employment. Ms. Lankswert immediately felt pain in
both elbows & her lower back from the impact on the stairs. Shortly after,
she was transported by another UPS Employee in their personal vehicle to
Concentra Health on Fern Valley Road. Concentra advised Ms. Lankswert that
they '...are not allowed to place UPS employees off work by law, due to
their account with UPS' and sent Ms. Lankswert back to full duty while
documenting a limited ROM in her arms. Ms. Lankswert was off work over the
weekend and attempted to recover at home.
 On February 11, 2025 Ms. Lankswert was still in immense pain and could
not await her follow up appointment with Concentra. Ms. Lankswert was seen
at Flaget Memorial Hospital who advised Ms. Lankswert to avoid driving,
sitting, or standing for long periods of time as well as to rest. Ms.
Lankswert then returned to Concentra on February 13, 2025, where she
explained to the physician that she was not able to fulfill her duties due
to the pain & Concentra provided restrictions for Ms. Lankswert. UPS
provided Concentra with a job description for an 'Air Handler', not a
'Fueler' and Concentra based their restrictions on the incorrect position
and stated Ms. Lankswert was about to return to modified duty & work her
full shift. When Ms. Lankswert shared these restrictions with her immediate
supervisor, Amy Roy, Ms. Roy advised Ms. Lankswert that they were not able
to accommodate her restrictions. Unfortunately, she was not scheduled to
see Concentra again for another 4 days, on February 17, 2025.
 From the date of her injury through February 17th, 2025, UPS made no
mention nor took any actions to discuss workers' compensation with Ms.
Lankswert. Instead, each evening (3rd shift employee), Ms. Roy would
contact Ms. Lankswert & ask her how she, Ms. Lankswert, wanted her off time
to 'coded' and given only the options of 'Call In', 'PTO' or 'Vacation'. On
at least one occasion, Ms. Lankswert was advised the 'Board was full' and
she had to take a Call In Occurrence. On February 14th, Ms. Lankswert
attempted to go in to work for her 'light duty position' and advised to sit
in the breakroom for the evening as they had no work available for her. Ms.
Lankswert was unable to stay her whole shift as the plastic chairs & steel
stools (photo provided) were causing more pain to her tailbone injury.
 Ms. Lankswert attended her February 17th appointment with Concentra
and felt her injuries were not being properly addressed so she followed up
the next day (02.18) with Advanced Injury & Rehab who placed Ms. Lankswert
off work until her MRI imaging results were obtained. The MRI shows at
least 2 bulging discs in Ms. Lankswert's lower lumbar spine and she has
been ordered to physical therapy.
 To date, Ms. Lankswert still has not received any information from UPS
in regards to her workers compensation claim. Our contact with the WC
Carrier has been very limited and only consists of continued denial of Ms.
Lankswert's TTD benefits from the Date of her incident through February
20th. The Adjuster is very short and only states UPS says there is
'suitable light duty' available to Ms. Lankswert, which is in direct
contradiction of Ms. Lankswert's immediate supervisor. When asked who is
stating there is suitable work, there is no response, only denial of
benefits.
 At this time, Ms. Lankswert has only work approximately 2 hrs (sitting
in a breakroom) since the date of her incident. We have requested that TTD
Benefits be issued & that her attendance status be reinstated as she should
not have accrued any Call Ins, used PTO and/or Vacation time in relation to
her work related injury. The Adjuster just simply states there is suitable
work able & denies benefits. We look forward to working with you toward an
amicable resolution and hearing from you shortly.
W. Bryce Koon
(502) 583-4022 Ext 114
Bryce@WhaleyLawFirm.com
Sarena M. Tuttle
Litigation Paralegal &
Workers' Compensation Case Manager
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
D: (502) 357-9971
O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104

Case: Shannon-Lankswert-WC-02-07-2025
Client: Shannon Lankswert
__Re: WC80D-H07503 Shannon Lankswert__
CC: Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
Good afternoon everyone,
 We have spoken with Ms. Lankswert's provider moments ago & they are
continuing to keep Ms. Lankswert Off Work until March 27, 2025 at which
time she will be re-evaluated. Please continue her TTD benefits and provide
an update on the past due TTD Benefits from the start of the claims
process.
 Further, we have received and reviewed the First Report Of Injury
(FROI) from yesterday's discussion and see there are several discrepancies
noted in the report. Beginning with her Pay Information, it is noted that
she is paid $999.99 a week, 3 days a week, and her salary did continue.
Mrs. Lankswert is a full time employee who works 5 days a week and her
salary did not continue, she was forced to use PTO & Vacation Time. 2nd,
her injuries are listed as a contusion on her elbow. There is no mention of
her back injury and the bulging disc that resulted from her fall. 3rd, the
Description of the incident, the report indicates she slipped on the 3rd of
4 steps, however, our understanding is that she slipped on the top step &
hit 3 steps on her way down. We are aware there are cameras covering this
specific area & have requested the surveillance footage from that time of
the incident with no response or acknowledgement from the Adjuster and or
your office. 4th, the report indicates "No Lost Time", as discussed Ms.
Lankswert has not returned to work due to her injuries and has now missed
26 work days with the exception of 2 hours she was forced to sit in the
breakroom until she could be properly evaluated by an unbiased medical
provider. Lastly, the report indicates "No Medical Treatment" under Initial
Treatment. Ms. Lankswert was immediately transported by her management team
to Concentra the same night of the incident.
 All of these items definitely make this incident seem very minor in
contrast to the reality of the situation and severity of Ms. Lankswert's
injuries. We have attached KAR 803.025.240 for your review & reference,
specifically highlighting Section 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7, all of which seem to be
in question in relation to this claim and the unfair claims practices that
are clearly evident in this file. At this time, we again request the
following as outlined in our initial letter of representation dated
February 20th, 2025:
Pursuant to Civil Rule 26 and 803 KAR 25:010(8), *please furnish an updated
and complete copy of the injured worker’s claim file within fifteen days of
this notice. This is a continuing request, which includes but is not
limited to*:
[1] Medical records;
[2] Pre-employment physicals/screenings/urinalysis;
[3] Average weekly wage documentation, including one year of wage records
preceding the injury;
[4] Temporary Total Disability ledger;
[5] Job description;
[6] Incident/OSHA reports[s], First Report of Injury and;
[7] Any photographs, video footage or recorded statements.
[8] Any and all Lien Information for At Fault 3rd Party

Completed comprehensive 5-phase file organization using systematic Case File Organization workflow:
